The sequence $(a_n)$ satisfies
\[a_1 + a_2 + a_3 + \dots + a_n = n^2 a_n\]for all $n \ge 2.$  If $a_{63} = 1,$ find $a_1.$
inference:
Setting $n = 63,$ we get
\[a_1 + a_2 + a_3 + \dots + a_{63} = 63^2 \cdot 1 = 3969.\]Setting $n = 62,$ we get
\[a_1 + a_2 + a_3 + \dots + a_{62} = 62^2 \cdot a_{62}.\]Subtracting these equations, we get
\[a_{63} = 63^2 \cdot 1 - 62^2 \cdot a_{62}.\]Since $a_{63} = 1,$
\[1 = 63^2 - 62^2 \cdot a_{62}.\]Then $a_{62} = \frac{63^2 - 1}{62^2} = \frac{3968}{3844} = \frac{992}{961}.$

Setting $n = 61,$ we get
\[a_1 + a_2 + a_3 + \dots + a_{61} = 61^2 \cdot a_{61}.\]Subtracting this equation from the equation $a_1 + a_2 + a_3 + \dots + a_{62} = 62^2 \cdot a_{62},$ we get
\[a_{62} = 62^2 \cdot a_{62} - 61^2 \cdot a_{61}.\]Then $a_{61} = \frac{62^2 \cdot a_{62} - a_{62}}{61^2} = \frac{62^2 - 1}{61^2} \cdot a_{62} = \frac{3843}{3721} \cdot \frac{992}{961} = \frac{3808}{3721}.$

We can continue in this way.  In general,
\[a_n = \frac{n^2 - 1}{(n - 1)^2} \cdot a_{n - 1}.\]Then
\begin{align*}
a_1 &= \frac{2^2 - 1}{1^2} \cdot a_2 \\
&= \frac{3^2 - 1}{2^2} \cdot \frac{4^2 - 1}{3^2} \cdot a_3 \\
&= \dotsb \\
&= \frac{63^2 - 1}{62^2} \cdot \frac{62^2 - 1}{61^2} \cdot \dotsb \cdot \frac{4^2 - 1}{3^2} \cdot \frac{3^2 - 1}{2^2} \cdot a_{63} \\
&= \frac{63^2 - 1}{62^2} \cdot \frac{62^2 - 1}{61^2} \cdot \dotsb \cdot \frac{4^2 - 1}{3^2} \cdot \frac{3^2 - 1}{2^2} \\
&= \frac{(63 - 1)(63 + 1)}{(62 - 1)(62 + 1)} \cdot \frac{(62 - 1)(62 + 1)}{(61 - 1)(61 + 1)} \cdot \dotsb \cdot \frac{(4 - 1)(4 + 1)}{(3 - 1)(3 + 1)} \cdot \frac{(3 - 1)(3 + 1)}{(2 - 1)(2 + 1)} \\
&= \frac{64}{61} \cdot \frac{63}{60} \cdot \frac{62}{59} \dotsb \cdot \frac{5}{2} \cdot \frac{4}{1} \\
&= \frac{64 \cdot 63 \cdot 62 \dotsb \cdot 5 \cdot 4}{61 \cdot 60 \cdot 59 \dotsb \cdot 2 \cdot 1} \\
&= \frac{64!}{61!}.
\end{align*}Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{64!}{61!}}.$  I hope it is correct.

From $a_1 + a_2 + a_3 + \dots + a_n = n^2 a_n,$
\[(n^2 - 1) a_n = a_1 + a_2 + \dots + a_{n - 2} + a_{n - 1}.\]Likewise,
\[((n - 1)^2 - 1) a_{n - 1} = a_1 + a_2 + \dots + a_{n - 2}.\]Subtracting these equations, we get
\[(n^2 - 1) a_n - ((n - 1)^2 - 1) a_{n - 1} = a_{n - 1},\]so
\[(n^2 - 1) a_n = (n - 1)^2 a_{n - 1}.\]Then $(n - 1)(n + 1) a_n = (n - 1)^2 a_{n - 1},$ so
\[a_n = \frac{n - 1}{n + 1} \cdot a_{n - 1}\]for all $n \ge 2.$

Therefore,
\begin{align*}
a_n &= \frac{n - 1}{n + 1} \cdot a_{n - 1} \\
&= \frac{n - 1}{n + 1} \cdot \frac{n - 2}{n} \cdot a_{n - 2} \\
&= \frac{n - 1}{n + 1} \cdot \frac{n - 2}{n} \cdot \frac{n - 3}{n - 1} \cdot a_{n - 3} \\
&= \dotsb \\
&= \frac{n - 1}{n + 1} \cdot \frac{n - 2}{n} \cdot \frac{n - 3}{n - 1} \dotsb \frac{2}{4} \cdot \frac{1}{3} \cdot a_1 \\
&= \frac{2a_1}{n(n + 1)}.
\end{align*}We are told that $a_{63} = 1,$ so
\[\frac{2a_1}{63 \cdot 64} = 1.\]Thus, $a_1 = \boxed{2016}.$

From $a_1 + a_2 + a_3 + \dots + a_n = n^2 a_n,$
\[(n^2 - 1) a_n = a_1 + a_2 + \dots + a_{n - 2} + a_{n - 1}.\]Likewise,
\[((n - 1)^2 - 1) a_{n - 1} = a_1 + a_2 + \dots + a_{n - 2}.\]Subtracting these equations, we get
\[(n^2 - 1) a_n - ((n - 1)^2 - 1) a_{n - 1} = a_{n - 1},\]so
\[(n^2 - 1) a_n = (n - 1)^2 a_{n - 1}.\]Then $(n - 1)(n + 1) a_n = (n - 1)^2 a_{n - 1},$ so
\[a_n = \frac{n - 1}{n + 1} \cdot a_{n - 1}\]for all $n \ge 2.$

Therefore,
\begin{align*}
a_n &= \frac{n - 1}{n + 1} \cdot a_{n - 1} \\
&= \frac{n - 1}{n + 1} \cdot \frac{n - 2}{n} \cdot a_{n - 2} \\
&= \frac{n - 1}{n + 1} \cdot \frac{n - 2}{n} \cdot \frac{n - 3}{n - 1} \cdot a_{n - 3} \\
&= \dotsb \\
&= \frac{n - 1}{n + 1} \cdot \frac{n - 2}{n} \cdot \frac{n - 3}{n - 1} \dotsb \frac{2}{4} \cdot \frac{1}{3} \cdot a_1 \\
&= \frac{2a_1}{n(n + 1)}.
\end{align*}We are told that $a_{63} = 1,$ so
\[\frac{2a_1}{63 \cdot 64} = 1.\]Thus, $a_1 = \boxed{2016}.$
